channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: SEC, States Investigate Firm Holding Couple's $763,094 Retirement Fund
item.description: The probes focus on Next Level Holdings and Yield Wealth, which offered investors the promise of double-digit returns.

item.title: Okta shares pop 18% on earnings beat, strong guidance
item.description: Okta shares soared Tuesday after the company reported strong third-quarter results.

item.title: EasyJet rakes in record $4.5 billion from fare add-ons as CEO slams 'unfair' penalty over practice
item.description: "It's a highly unfair idea that you should not be able to offer products and services targeted for those people who want to use that," Johan Lundgren ...

item.title: Salesforce shares rise after earnings beat on revenue, fourth-quarter guidance
item.description: Salesforce reported its fiscal third-quarter earnings on Tuesday and posted strong fourth-quarter guidance.

item.title: Trump Picks Paul Atkins to Run SEC
item.description: The former SEC commissioner is expected to ease oversight, including on cryptocurrency firms.

item.title: Dollar Falls After Services PMI Data
item.description: The dollar weakened after the ISM services PMI November print declined more than economists expected.

item.title: Foot Locker shares tumble as it issues gloomy holiday outlook, sees 'softness' at Nike
item.description: Foot Locker fell short of Wall Street expectations and cut its guidance after sales declined more than expected.

item.title: Gold Edges Higher After U.S. Job Creation Slowed
item.description: Gold prices rose after U.S. jobs data showed private payrolls growth was less than expected in November.

item.title: Salesforce surges on revenue beat, AI growth prospects â€“ here's our new price target for the stock
item.description: Salesforce made clear that Agentfoce, its new AI offering, can kickstart revenue growth in the quarters ahead.

item.title: U.S. Crude Oil Stockpiles Fall More Than Expected
item.description: U.S. crude oil inventories fell more than expected last week and product stocks saw a buildup as refineries ramped up their capacity use.
